item.name: Christopher's House
item.description: This venue used for testing. Secret location of conceptDawg's research lair. This is where he prototypes dangerous plans and evil schemes like LibraryThing Local and Common Knowledge. LibraryThing developer, conceptDawg.

item.name: The King's English Bookshop
item.description: The King's English has been Salt Lake's literary resource for independent minds since 1977. We have the most comprehensive children's book selection in the state of Utah as well as mysteries, new fiction, poetry, literary nonfiction, nature, and western writers. Located in a beautiful residential neighborhood of Salt Lake City, the store provides services to people anywhere in the world. If you are in town, drop by; there are chairs scattered throughout eight book-packed rooms.

item.name: Little Library at 1438 Logan Ave.
item.description: "In Honor of Wilma Lindahl"

item.name: Giovale Library - Westminster College
item.description:
Campus library for Westminster College.
From the library website:
Home of an expansive collection of up-to-date books and journals, the Giovale Library also has the latest in technology, including approximately 95 online databases, e-books and e-journals, a wireless network, a General Computing Lab with 47 workstations, a Writing Center and an Assistive Technology Lab.

item.name: Central Book Exchange
item.description: Bookstore in the Sugarhouse area that sells and buys used books. Also stocks some new books,

item.name: Barnes & Noble Booksellers - Sugarhouse
item.description: McIntyre Center

item.name: Salt Lake City Public Library: Sprague Branch
Salt Lake City Public Library: Anderson-Foothill Branch
Christian Science Reading Room (Second Church of Christ, Scientist) - Salt Lake City
item.description: Sun 11:30 am - 12:00 noon

item.name: Marriott Library
item.description:
The J. Willard Marriott Library is the main library on the University of Utah campus.
Some statistics from the library's website:
• Houses nearly 2.8 million volumes totaling over $300 million in value • Has recently added an automatic retrieval system (ARC) with a capacity of 2 million volumes, the largest facility of its type in North America • Offers 151,806 electronic publications • Operates three campus computer labs • Ranks 44 out of the 113 largest university research libraries in North America (members of Association of Research Libraries (ARL). • Contains one of the nation's largest Middle East libraries (among the top five) • Spans 500,000 square feet between the original building (1968) and the new wing (1996)

item.name: University of Utah Campus Store and Bookmark at the U
item.description:
The University Campus Store is located near the center of campus, with parking conveniently located just to the south of the store.
The Bookmark at the U is the General Books department at the Campus Store and is a full service bookstore. We have a wide range of books including general fiction, test prep and study guides as well as a wide selection of books from University Presses from around the country.

item.name: S.J. Quinney Law Library
item.description:
Library of the University of Utah's S.J. Quinney School of Law.
From the library's website:
The library contains over 295,000 volumes and microform equivalents. All basic legal research tools are present. Practice materials are not, as a rule, actively acquired, although many are present in the collection. The collection is extensive or complete in codes, digests, reporters, encyclopedias, citators, and journals. Many areas of legal research are well developed in the monograph collection. Subject specialties exist in the areas of tax, public land, environmental and energy law.

item.name: A. Ray Olpin Student Union - University of Utah
Columbus Library
item.description:
From the library website:
Columbus Library located in the beautiful, newly remodeled, Spanish style Columbus School Building offers a wide selection of Children and Adult material. Enjoy the work of local artists as you browse a wide assortment of DVD's, CD's, Books on CD and tape or look for a book. Enjoy a puppet show put on by your own children in our puppet theater or study at one of the conveniently located tables. The building also houses Salt Lake County Parks and Recreation and a Senior Citizen Center. Enjoy a class put on by Parks and Rec and then learn more about it at the library or enjoy the book talks, storytimes and other programs sponsored by the library.
Columbus Library offers:
* Wireless internet * Computers with internet * Excel * Word * Powerpoint * Self check out * Spanish collection * Friendly staff

item.name: SuzyQBooks
item.description: SuzyQBooks is a family owned, used-book store featuring vintage books. We love digging through old books. We clean them up and list them for sale online, and now at our new location at 1618 S. Main, Salt Lake City, Utah. Open Tuesday thru Saturday 10 to 6. Closed Sunday and Monday.

item.name: Eccles Health Sciences Library
item.description:
From the library website:
The Spencer S. Eccles Health Sciences Library serves the educational, research, and clinical needs of health professionals, students and researchers at the University of Utah Health Sciences Center and through-out the Intermountain region. Eccles Health Sciences Library is a Regional Medical Library (RML) for the Midcontinental Region in the National Network of Libraries of Medicine (NN/LM) awarded by the National Library of Medicine. The Library is located south of, and adjacent to, the University of Utah Health Science Center.

item.name: The Leonardo
item.description: The Leonardo is a contemporary museum that explores the unexpected ways that science, technology, art, and creativity connect. Located in the heart of downtown Salt Lake City, The Leo is your place to see one-of-a-kind, interactive exhibits and participate in ever-changing programs, workshops, and classes. Once home to the Salt Lake City Public Library, The Leonardo’s building has been a center for learning, curiosity, and discovery for the people of the Wasatch Front for nearly 50 years. The Leo is tremendously proud to carry on that legacy, and invite you to become a part of this unique museum experience.

item.name: Salt Lake City Public Library - Main Library
item.description:
The library's underground parking facility can be accessed by turning mid-block from eastbound 400 South. Parking in this facility is free for the first half-hour, then $1.25 per half-hour after that.
Any vehicle displaying a disability special group license plate or disability windshield placard may park in the parking garage at Library Square for two hours with no charge. Additional time beyond the two hours is $1.25 per half-hour.

item.name: Golden Braid Books
item.description:
From the bookstore's website:
At Golden Braid Books we offer a host of items that will assist you along your journey. Books for feeding of mind, spirit, body, soul & heart; luscious healthcare products to refresh and revive you; beautiful gifts to inspire and lift your spirits or someone else’s.

item.name: Huntsman Cancer Learning Center
item.description: The Huntsman Cancer Learning Center is a service of the Huntsman Cancer Institute. It includes a circulating library of materials relating to cancer, its prevention, and its treatments.

item.name: Ken Sanders Rare Books
item.description:
From the store website:
Ken Sanders Rare Books is a full service antiquarian bookshop located in downtown Salt Lake City.
Our almost 5,000 square foot open shop features over 100,000 new, used and rare books. We have a general stock in most fields with paperbacks and reading copies for the casual reader, as well as more expensive first editions and collector's copies of rare and fine books.
We specialize in Utah and the Mormons, Western Americana, Native Americana, Exploration and discovery of the West; travel and adventure, natural history; the Grand Canyon, Colorado River and Colorado Plateau, Yellowstone, Yosemite and National Parks and wilderness and the environment.
We also feature the complete works of Edward Abbey, Wallace Stegner, B. Traven and other literary first editions, including many signed modern first editions. The emphasis is on the literary west, novelists, poets and naturalists. We carry selections on poetry, literary biography, plays, Native American literature, Latin literature, Asian literature and Black literature. We also carry mystery and dectective fiction; fantasy and science fiction and western fiction.
Our general stock includes Art, Architecture, Photography, the Arts, Music, Theater, Film and other performing arts. History, Biography, Religion, Metaphysics, Sets, Leather and other fine bindings; Classics & 19th century literature, Book Arts and books on books; science, medicine, psychology, anthropology and archaeology; outdoors, natural history and transportation and sports and games. We also carry a large inventory of children's and illustrated books.

item.name: Calvin S. Smith Library
item.description:
Calvin S. Smith Library has been part of the south Salt Lake City neighborhoods since 1943. It has all the amenities of a larger library, including wireless internet access and 11 computers with internet access and word processing capabilities, but retains the more personal atmosphere of a smaller library. Smith Library offers a wide selection of movies, current fiction and non-fiction, music, and audio books. Patrons also have access to materials from any Salt Lake County library by reserving popular books, movies and more and then choosing to pick them up at the conveniently and centrally located Smith Library.
Holdings: 56,090 items

item.name: Christian Science Reading Room (Third Church of Christ, Scientist) - Salt Lake City
item.description: Mon - Fri 11:00 am - 4:00 pm Sat 12:00 noon - 4:00 pm Call to confirm hours

item.name: Beehive Tea Room And Wedding Library
item.description: An eclectic, old-style tea room, in downtown Salt Lake City. It contains a sizable (non-circulating) library of materials relating to weddings and wedding planning.

item.name: Eborn Books
item.description: Experience the largest inventory of new, used, and rare books in the entire state of Utah. Over 500,000 new, used, rare, and out-of print books to choose from!

item.name: Weller Book Works
item.description:
Weller Book Works was founded as Zion Bookstore over 80 years ago. Over the years we’ve been known as Sam Weller’s Books and Sam Weller’s Zion Bookstore. We are in our third generation of operations, owned and managed by Catherine and Tony Weller. Our bookstore sells new, used and rare books in a space built to surprise and delight you in historic Trolley Square. You can find Weller Book Works just off the 600 S. entrance to Trolley Square or you can search our inventory here on our website. Either way, we’re delighted to answer your questions and help you select just the right book.*
* Text taken directly from their website listed above.

item.name: Millcreek Community Library
item.description: 20,000 square foot library was rebuilt as part of a 65,000 square foot community center. New center opened April 12, 2012. Community Center includes full size gym, Recreation Center and senior activities. Community Café open to the public for breakfast and lunch. Beautiful Evergreen Park, playground and picnic pavilion adjacent to west side of the library. 26 Internet computers with access to Microsoft products and printing availabilities. Free WiFi available throughout the community center. Large meeting rooms (capacity of 33, 60, or 100 people) and 2 small conference rooms (one for 4 people and one for 8 people). Teen Room with its own computers. Dedicated Book Club Collection. Quiet reading area. Reading seating overlooking the park. Lots of programs for kids, teens and adults. Customer Service oriented staff.

item.name: B & W Collector Books
item.description: We have an open bookstore with approximately 60,000 titles. We specialize in rare LDS or Mormon books. We have a large selection of modern first editions, rare children's books and western Americana. Our hours are 10AM - 6PM weekdays, Saturday 1PM - 5PM.

item.name: Church History Library
item.description: The collections of the the Church History Library and Archives contain materials chronicling the history of the Church from its beginning in 1830 to the present day. The collections contain manuscripts, books, Church records, photographs, oral histories, architectural drawings, pamphlets, newspapers, periodicals, maps, microforms, and audiovisual materials. The staff creates and maintains catalogs and indexes for accessing this wide variety of information.

item.name: Benchmark Books
item.description: Hours: 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Mon-Fri 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Sat. Closed Sundays

item.name: Salt Lake City Public Library: Corinne and Jack Sweet Branch
Family History Library
item.description:
Background:
• Founded in 1894 to gather genealogical records and assist members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with their family history and genealogical research • Largest library of its kind in the world • Open to the general public at no charge • Visited by an estimated 1,900 patrons or more each day
Records Collection:
• The collection includes over 2.4 million rolls of microfilmed genealogical records; 742,000 microfiche; 310,000 books, serials, and other formats; 4,500 periodicals; 700 electronic resources. • The Ancestral File database contains more than 36 million names that are linked into families. • The International Genealogical Index database contains approximately 600 million names of deceased individuals. An addendum to the International Genealogical Index contains an additional 125 million names. These names have been patron submitted or extracted from thousands of original birth, christening and marriage records. • The Pedigree Resource File database contains over 80 million names that are linked into families. • Records available are from the United States, Canada, the British Isles, Europe, Latin America, Asia, and Africa. • In 2003, the collection increased monthly by an average of 4,100 rolls of film, 700 books, and 16 electronic resources. • A majority of the records contain information about persons who lived before 1930. • Approximately 200 cameras are currently microfilming records in over 45 countries. Records have been filmed in over 110 countries, territories, and possessions.
Patron Resources:
• 202 patron computers • 509 microfilm readers • 36 microfiche readers • 28 microfilm and microfiche copiers • 4 microfilm scanners • 15 book copiers • Seating capacity for 396 at tables • Orientation and research classes
Personnel:
• Currently 125 full-time and part-time professional staff • Approximately 400 trained volunteers

item.name: Utah State Archives and Research Center
item.description: The Research Center is a public research facility operated by the Utah State Archives and Utah State History. Research manuscripts, photographs, books, maps, and online resources about Utah and the West and historic state and local government records in Utah, from 1850 to today. Material cannot be checked-out, but most may be copied.

item.name: Little Library at 4512 Juniper Dr.
item.description: "In Honor of Everyone Who Reads"

item.name: Salt Lake City Public Library: Chapman Branch
Holladay Library
item.description:
From the library website:
Holladay Library has a longstanding tradition of service to the Holladay Community.
Come and visit us at our newly renovated library. New carpeting and paint, improved lighting and a time-saving self-checkout system are just some of the exciting changes. Attractive displays have been added, highlighting our most popular titles. Children and teens will enjoy an expanded schedule of programs just for them.
With 14 public computers and the new wireless ”laptop lane,” computer users have more access than ever.
A calendar of events planned for Holladay Library is listed in the system's Programs and Events.
A meeting room with an 60 person capacity is available for public meetings. A conference room for smaller groups is also available.
Holdings: 92, 095

item.name: Calvary Chapel Salt Lake City - The Chapel Store
Barnes & Noble Booksellers - The Pointe at 53rd
Murray Public Library
item.description: Friendly library with lots of popular titles and programs.

item.name: Salt Lake City Public Library: Day-Riverside Branch
Ruth Vine Tyler Library
item.description:
From the library website:
The Ruth Vine Tyler Library has been serving Salt Lake County residents since 1967 and is known as "the Salt Lake County Library System's best kept secret". The library may be off the main thoroughfares, but is well worth discovering in its friendly neighborhood setting. Tyler was remodeled in 2000, making the building look even more spacious and providing more room for the collection, Internet computers and service desks. Tyler has a good collection of art books, including many oversized publications. There is a growing collection of books, music and films for Spanish-speaking customers. The video, DVD and audio book collections are also very popular. The children's room has inviting displays and a colorful adventure carpet for children to enjoy. A meeting room with an 80 person capacity is available for public meetings.
Holdings: 65,942 items
Niches: Art Books

item.name: Markosian Library - Salt Lake Community College
item.description:
From the library website:
The Salt Lake Community College library system has 99,094 print books and about 500 print periodical subscriptions, access to 75 electronic databases which include full text articles and indexing/abstracting services, as well as access to 81 electronic reference titles, over 35,000 e-books, and over 600 e-journals.
The Media collection contains approximately 30,774 items for viewing, listening and watching. Telecourse videos also are available for checkout.
Library staff provides assistance with: research and reference questions; inter-library and inter-campus loans; and training to assist in using the library's resources and accessing the Internet.
Patrons may access the library's online catalog and many of its electronic indexing and full text database services through any computer on campus or off-campus via the Internet.
The library at Redwood also provides group study space, as well as individual and group media viewing areas on its lower level; an InfoCommons area with computer lab, laptop and wireless card checkout; an art exhibit area; and a coffee shop and lounge. Coin-operated copy machines are available at all campus libraries.

item.name: LifeWay Christian Store - Salt Lake City (Murray)

address.street: Salt Lake City International Airport, Terminal C

item.name: Taylorsville Library
item.description:
From the library website:
Formerly the Park Library, the Taylorsville Library is located just north of Valley Regional Park, with easy access off I-215. This friendly library has a well rounded children's collection. It also includes videos, audio books, CDs, DVDs, CD-ROMs, and a small Spanish language collection. It is a cozy library with a reading alcove of fiction books and magazines for young adults. This library also provides Internet terminals for public use. A meeting room with a 60 person capacity is available for public meetings.
Holdings: 109,642 items
Niches: Investment

item.name: Whitmore Library
item.description:
From the library website:
Whitmore Library opened in 1974. Three years later, an addition was built at the north end of the building. The Library was completely renovated in 1993-94. For many years, Whitmore served as the headquarters library in the County System; the Library Administration and support services are still located on the lower floor.
Collections and services unique to Whitmore include:
* Utah outdoor and recreation materials * Back files on microfilm of the Deseret News, Salt Lake Tribune and the New York Times * Mail-a-Book program for the home-bound
A meeting room with an 70 person capacity is available for public meetings.

item.name: Hastur Games & Comics
item.description: A games and comics shop featuring a good selection of RPGs, board games, and comic books. There are also a number of computers with internet connections for online gaming.

item.name: Gametique at The Quilted Bear (Midvale)
item.description: Gametique is a board and card game store located in craft boutiques across Utah. It carries a wide variety of board games such as Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride, Killer Bunnies, Blokus, Curses and children's games.

item.name: Hunter Library
item.description:
From the library website:
Hunter Library houses over 175,000 volumes of print and audio visual materials: including DVD's, music CD's, CD-Rom's, Books-on-CD, and Books-on-Tape for all age and reading levels. We subscribe to 21 local, national and international newspapers, including La Opinion (Hispanic) and Kalonikali (Tongan). Hunter also houses over 350 magazine titles for children, teens, and adults, with back issues available for checkout. Need an Internet connection? We have 22 PC's that access the Internet and offer word processing - and bring your laptop to access our wireless connection. Hunter is equipped with a self checkout system, but our friendly staff is always available to help you.
Hunter has the largest and most diverse collection of Spanish materials in the County, with over 6,300 in our collection. In addition to print materials, you will find DVD's, CD's, Books-on-CD or on cassette. For those wanting to learn English, Hunter has a large collection of "English as a Second Language" materials to choose from. We currently have three Spanish-speaking librarians on staff to help our growing Latino population. Our language learning collection features material in over 40 different languages.
To serve our growing younger population, Hunter offers Baby n' Me storytimes for children ages 6 months to 2 ½ years, and combined storytime for those 2 ½ to 5 years-old. Our "Ready-to-Read" collection features resources to help parents prepare their children to learn to read: books, videos & DVD's, phonics, & concept books. We also offer a wide variety of programs throughout the year for all age groups. Our large meeting room can accommodate 60 people and is available for community groups to reserve.
Collection Holdings: 178,451
Special Areas: Ready-to-Read Spanish Materials LDS fiction and non-fiction Collectibles

item.name: Kearns Library
item.description:
From the library website:
Kearns Library is dedicated to providing the best possible service to its diverse patronage. It opened its doors in 1965 and is considered a "family library" by many who enjoy the well stocked shelves. There is something here for everyone; from Harry Potter to Genealogy and from Science Fiction/Fantasy to Spanish language materials. Kearns features much more than just books, many people enjoy our DVDs, CDs and combination Book/CDs for children. Our databases supply endless information and our public use computers are always in great demand. A meeting room with an 80 person capacity is available for public meetings.
Holdings: 89,010 items
Niches: Young Adult Fiction and Horror Fiction
